lead_paragraph: A growing chorus of shareholders is worried the energy giant is not adequately preparing for tighter times in light of the Paris accord.

byline.contributor: Clifford Krauss reported from Houston and John Schwartz from New York.
byline.original: By CLIFFORD KRAUSS and JOHN SCHWARTZ

headline.print_headline: Investors Press Exxon to Rate Climate Risks
headline.main: Exxon Investors Seek Assurance as Climate Shifts, Along With Attitudes

snippet: A growing chorus of shareholders is worried the energy giant is not adequately preparing for tighter times in light of the Paris accord.
abstract: Growing number of Exxon Mobil shareholders, worried that company is not adequately prepared for leaner times in light of Paris accord, are pressing it to explain how it plans to deal with climate change mandates; group is set to vote during annual meeting in Dallas on resolution to prod Exxon to disclose risks of climate change even as company projects that global demand for oil will keep growing.
